metadata.Title: CVE-2015-6824 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The sws_init_context function in libswscale/utils.c in FFmpeg before 2.7.2 does not initialize certain pixbuf data structures, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (segmentation violation) or possibly have unspecified other impact via crafted video data.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-6824` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:2.8.3-1
libav-tools - 7:2.8.3-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:2.8.3-1
libavcodec-ffmpeg-extra56 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavcodec-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavdevice-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavfilter-ffmpeg5 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavformat-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavresample-ffmpeg2 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavutil-ffmpeg54 - 7:2.8.3-1
libpostproc-ffmpeg53 - 7:2.8.3-1
libswresample-ffmpeg1 - 7:2.8.3-1
libswscale-ffmpeg3 - 7:2.8.3-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> as of 2016-03-11, no equivalent fix in libav ebarretto> as of 2018-09-27, no equivalent fix in libav

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:2.8.3-1').
